page.title: 05FARMING IN THE LOWMAN VALLEY
page.content: A lot of{farming}takes place in the north, south and east of our area. This is because the land is very fertile and {flat.}One type of farming is{arable,}although some{dairy farming does take place. When interviewed, one farmer at {HIGHER BINGWELL}told us that he had mainly{sheep}and{beef{stock.}The farmer specialises in{cows.}He breeds them, then sends them away to be slaughtered. The farmer also grows various{cereal crops.} The farmer prefers the old fashioned way of life, although he does like {modern machinery}as it reduces labour. He owns 30 acres, and on some of these fields, his 260{sheep}graze.
